$SPY 
For my followers. 
 
I want to make clear that I am not a trader. However, I will not miss clear opportunities if a stock price reach a reasonable value that makes it worthy of investment or intelligent speculation. 
 
In either case of investing or intelligent speculation, it's essential that you perform analysis and hold a strong temperament throughout the process. It is essential to not go 'all in' in one wager. It is better to wager your money equally over a number of bets.  
  
A good practice could be to sell once your capital appreciates by 2-5%. No one says that you need to wait for your thesis to fully play out. If you received a satisfactory return on your thesis while it was playing out: collect profits and call it day. 
 
I am still bearish regarding technology companies at current prices. I do expect companies like $FB $AAPL to beat earnings though. Once valuations become aligned with what I believe is fair, I will look deeper into current conditions.
